snippet: Seldom have the candidates’ divergent approaches to campaigning been on more vivid display than in the final days of the race....
abstract: Final week of presidential campaign offer clearest example of Hillary Clinton's and Donald Trump's divergent approaches to campaigning; Clinton is mobilizing vast field organization and dispatching top campaign surrogates, particularly in few large swing states, to home in on minority turnout, while Trump is delivering broad-brush message that Clinton is corrupt and  visiting states that he has very little chance of winning.

byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS and JONATHAN MARTIN
byline.contributor: Matt Flegenheimer contributed reporting from Winterville, N.C.; Alan Rappeport from Berwyn, Pa.; and Amy Chozick from New York.

lead_paragraph: Seldom have the candidates’ divergent approaches to campaigning been on more vivid display than in the final days of the race.

headline.main: Clinton Pushes Minority Turnout as Trump Tries to Rally His Base
headline.print_headline: Campaigns Attack Election Map in Widely Divergent Game Plans
